articleContent.title: Chord: 13th in G# (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 13th in G# (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The G#13 chord, often played using the D-shaped formation, is a rich and colorful chord with a complex and expressive sound. It consists of several notes that give it a jazz-infused quality and can add depth and sophistication to a musical piece.

## Notes and Intervals
The G#13 chord typically includes the notes G#, C, D#, F#, and A# in its full form. This chord is constructed based on intervals of a major third, minor third, perfect fourth, and minor seventh, creating a full and harmonically intriguing sound.

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The G#13 chord is commonly used in jazz, blues, funk, and soul music due to its rich and colorful tonality. It adds a sense of tension and release, creating a smooth and jazzy vibe to a musical composition. This chord is often used in improvisation and comping, bringing a sense of sophistication and complexity to the music.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the G#13 chord in its D-shaped formation:
1. "Autumn Leaves" - This jazz standard often utilizes the G#13 chord to create a rich and harmonically lush sound in the chord progressions.
2. "I Wish" by Stevie Wonder - The funk-fueled sound of this song is enhanced by the use of the G#13 chord, adding depth and complexity to the musical arrangement.
3. "Stormy Monday" by T-Bone Walker - This blues classic showcases the G#13 chord in a soulful and emotive context, emphasizing the expressive potential of this chord in blues music.
